hero.heading: What is AWS & EC2?
hero.intro: Learn why we use AWS instead of buying servers, and how EC2 works like a rented computer in the cloud.

sections.title: What is AWS?
content: AWS (Amazon Web Services) is the world's largest cloud platform.
It allows you to rent servers, storage, and databases over the internet.
Tanglish: Veetla inverter vachirukka maari, but factory ku EB la power vangura maari. We rent powerful computers from AWS.

sections.title: Why use AWS? (Vs Traditional)
content: Traditional IT: Buy servers, pay maintenance, hard to scale.
AWS Cloud: Rent servers, no maintenance, scale instantly.
Cost: Pay only for what you use (Pay-as-you-go).

sections.title: What is EC2?
content: EC2 stands for Elastic Compute Cloud.
It provides Virtual Servers (computers) in the cloud.
You can launch a server in minutes, install any OS (Windows/Linux), and run your apps.
Elastic means flexible: Increase or decrease servers based on traffic (e.g., Diwali Sale).

summary: AWS is a rental shop for IT infrastructure.
EC2 is a virtual server you can rent.
Cloud computing saves money and allows instant scaling.
